WI+RE: Writing Instruction and Research Education

Quick and practical research and writing strategies, collaboratively designed by students, teachers, and librarians at UCLA.

For students
For instructors
All Tutorials

Where would you like to start?

Check out one of our themed collections or see a list of all our tutorials.

Getting Started

Generating research questions, planning your project, and getting ready for research.

Finding and Citing Sources

Learn practical strategies to search for books, articles, and more.

Literature Reviews

Get ready to analyze the literature on your topic and identify areas for future scholarship.

Sharing your Research

A quick introduction to abstracts, elevator speeches, and opportunities to share your work.

Improve student writing and research skills with our easy to implement online assignments.


Adding WI+RE modules to your CCLE site or integrating them into your syllabus is easy. Instructors from north and south campus have successfully included the modules as required, extra credit, and optional assignments.

Contact the WI+RE team to learn more about integrating WI+RE modules into your courses.

Contact the WI+RE team

As strong believers in open educational resources, all of our code is open source, and our tips can be shared, re-used, and re-mixed for free.

Our content is available through a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike license.
This site is built in Jekyll and hosted on Github pages. The front page is based the lovely Creative Theme, and sub-pages are built on a jekyll version of materialize css.
Want to collaborate? Us too! Let us know your ideas!


See our code!
